data.Sentence_cn: 日本每年过一次“亡灵节”。
data.Sentence: A Festival for the Dead is held once a year in Japan.

data.Sentence_cn: 这个节日是个欢乐的日子，
data.Sentence: This festival is a cheerful occasion,

data.Sentence_cn: 因为在这一天，据说死去的人要回到他们的家里来，活着的人则对他们表示欢迎。
data.Sentence: for on this day, the dead are said to return to their homes and they are welcomed by the living.

data.Sentence_cn: 因为预料到他们在经过长途旅行之后会感到饥饿，所以为他们摆放好了食品。
data.Sentence: As they are expected to be hungry after their long journey, food is laid out for them.

data.Sentence_cn: 特制的灯笼挂在各家的门外，为的是帮助亡灵看清道路。
data.Sentence: Specially-made lanterns are hung outside each house to help the dead to find their way.

data.Sentence_cn: 整个夜晚人们载歌载舞。
data.Sentence: All night long, people dance and sing.

data.Sentence_cn: 一大早，人们便把为死者摆放的食品扔进河中或海里，
data.Sentence: In the early morning, the food that had been laid out for the dead is thrown into a river or into the sea

data.Sentence_cn: 因为人们认为活着的人吃了这些东西是不吉利的。
data.Sentence: as it is considered unlucky for anyone living to eat it.
In towns that are near the sea,

data.Sentence_cn: 头天夜里挂在大街小巷的小灯笼在节后就放在了水里。
data.Sentence: the tiny lanterns which had been hung in the streets the night before,are placed into the water when the festival is over.

data.Sentence_cn: 成千上万只灯笼慢慢漂向大海，指引着亡灵返回另一个世界。
data.Sentence: Thousands of lanterns slowly drift out to sea guiding the dead on their return journey to the other world.

data.Sentence_cn: 人们成群地伫立在海岸上，注视着灯笼远去，直到再也看不见为止。---制作人:lintelite
data.Sentence: for crowds of people stand on the shore watching the lanterns drifting away until they can be seen no more.
